code_value: More than 80 percent of the presentations given by business school students rely on PowerPoint rather than the old-fashioned flowing narrative. "But what's fine for a business professional might not be so fine for a child," says a professor at MIT, "They change how our kids grow up and how they process information. PowerPoint doesn't teach children to make an argument. It encourages presentation, not conversation. A strong presentation is designed to close down debate, rather than open it up."
